intro: Cistanthera fouassieri, commonly known as the Madagascar moonseed, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. It produces small, round fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
